Issues.Title: Invalid `inject()` function typing
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

`inject()`'s type description seems to be invalid:
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/5cfde8b23e72cff4c9359f765a462b474bb32631/packages/core/src/di/injector_compatibility.ts#L78-L80

Return type should be `T | null` only if flag is set to `InjectFlags.Optional` meaning that the signature should be something like this:

```typescript
 export function ɵɵinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>): T; 
 export function ɵɵinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags?: InjectFlags.Default | InjectFlags...): T; 
 export function ɵɵinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags?: InjectFlags.Optional): T | null; 
 export function ɵɵinject<T>(token: ProviderToken<T>, flags = InjectFlags.Default): T|null
```

### Description

              {maxRetries.value, plural, =0 {Lock account on every bad logon attempt} =1 {Wait one bad logon attempt
              before lock account} other {Wait {{ maxRetries.value }} bad logon attempts before lock account}}
  </ng-container>
```

<mat-slide-toggle formControlName="autoUnProvisioningStatus" i18n="label|label for autoUnProvisioningStatus">
            {delayBeforeAutoUnProvisioning.value, plural, =0 {Not allowed Automatic un-provisioning of users} =1 {Wait

            {{ delayBeforeAutoUnProvisioning.value }} days without authentication before user unprovisionoing}}

          {inputDuration.value, plural, =0 {Tokens will not time out} other {Tokens time out after
          {{ inputDuration.duration | displayedDuration }} }}
</ng-container>

ng extract-i18n --output-path src
```

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/cli): during an update only use package manager force option with npm 7+
Issues.Body:
The package manager `--force` option is only relevant to npm 7+ wherein the option controls
the strictness of the npm 7+ peer dependency resolution. Yarn 2+ does not support a `--force`
option. When the `ng update` `--force` option was used, `ng update` was incorrectly
applying the package manager `--force` option to Yarn which lead to an installation failure.
This has now been corrected and the package manager `--force` option is now only applied to npm 7+.

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): remove unneeded TypeScript transforms with esbuild
Issues.Body:
Only the `replaceBootstrap` TypeScript transform is needed with the `browser-esbuild` builder.
The `replaceBootstrap` transform converts the default generated JIT bootstrap call into an AOT
bootstrap call within an application. The other transforms were used to remove the development
and JIT related metadata from the AOT compiler generated code. However, with the esbuild based
build pipeline, these will be automatically removed without the need for additional transforms
via the earlier usage of the `ngJitMode` and `ngDevMode` defines.

Issues.Title: Avoid serving legacy JavaScript to modern browsers
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

Using latest Angular 14, polyfills are injected in the DOM at the end of `</body>` with

```
<script src="polyfills.js" type="module">
```

next to all other JS.

We could improve performance by not loading those polyfills to modern browser at all. Lighthouse show this info in the report as well.

### Proposed solution

With `nomodule` in `<script>` we indicate ES2015+ browser to not load the polyfills at first. Legacy browsers on the contrary don't know this tag and load the `<script>` as usual.

More info: https://midzer.de/how-to-skip-loading-polyfills-in-modern-browsers

### Alternatives considered

Hmm, right now, I can't think of other options on how to to do it in a non-JS way.
